introduction.title: Vietnamese Conditional Sentences
content: Vietnamese conditionals use the 'Nếu...thì' structure to express if-then relationships. Unlike English, Vietnamese doesn't change verb forms for different conditional types—context and tense markers determine the type.
The basic pattern is: Nếu + [condition], thì + [result]. Both 'nếu' (if) and 'thì' (then) can be omitted in casual speech when context is clear.
Vietnamese has three main conditional types: real/possible (things that can happen), unreal/counterfactual (things that didn't happen), and habitual/general (things that always happen).

components.usage: Introduces the condition. Can be replaced with 'nếu như' for emphasis.
Introduces the result. Often omitted in casual speech, but preferred in formal contexts.

examples.vietnamese: Nếu trời mưa thì tôi sẽ không đi làm
examples.english: If it rains, I will not go to work
examples.literalEnglish: If weather rain then I will not go work

examples.vietnamese: Nếu trời mưa, tôi sẽ không đi làm
examples.english: If it rains, I will not go to work
examples.literalEnglish: If weather rain, I will not go work
examples.notes: Casual variant: comma replaces 'thì' (more common in speech)

conditionalTypes.title: Real/Possible Conditionals
conditionalTypes.description: Describes something that can or might happen. Used for present and future situations that are plausible.
conditionalTypes.pattern: Nếu + present tense, thì + future/present tense

examples.vietnamese: Nếu bạn học chăm chỉ thì bạn sẽ thành công
examples.english: If you study hard, you will succeed
examples.literalEnglish: If you study diligently then you will succeed

examples.vietnamese: Nếu anh đói thì anh có thể ăn bánh mì này
examples.english: If you're hungry, you can eat this sandwich
examples.literalEnglish: If you hungry then you can eat bread this

examples.vietnamese: Nếu có thời gian tôi sẽ đến thăm bạn
examples.english: If I have time, I will visit you
examples.literalEnglish: If have time I will come visit you

conditionalTypes.title: Unreal/Counterfactual Conditionals
conditionalTypes.description: Describes something that didn't happen or a hypothetical past situation. The key is using 'đã' in the result clause to indicate the action didn't actually occur.
conditionalTypes.whenToUse: Regrets, hypothetical past scenarios, 'what if' situations
conditionalTypes.keyPoint: The 'đã' in the result clause signals this is counterfactual—something that didn't actually happen

examples.vietnamese: Nếu tôi không nói thế thì anh đã không đến đây
examples.english: If I hadn't said that, you wouldn't have come here
examples.literalEnglish: If I not say like-that then you past not come here
examples.notes: 'đã' in result clause marks this as counterfactual past

examples.vietnamese: Nếu tôi biết thì tôi đã giúp bạn
examples.english: If I had known, I would have helped you
examples.literalEnglish: If I know then I past help you
examples.notes: Expressing regret about not helping (because I didn't know)

examples.vietnamese: Nếu anh ấy học nhiều hơn thì đã thi đỗ
examples.english: If he had studied more, he would have passed the exam
examples.literalEnglish: If he study much more then past pass-exam
examples.notes: Implies he didn't study enough and didn't pass

conditionalTypes.title: Habitual/General Conditionals
conditionalTypes.description: Describes something that generally or always happens. These express universal truths or habitual patterns.
conditionalTypes.pattern: Nếu + present, thì + present (both clauses present tense)
conditionalTypes.whenToUse: General rules, habits, cause-and-effect that always applies

examples.vietnamese: Nếu trời nóng thì tôi uống nhiều nước
examples.english: If it's hot, I drink a lot of water
examples.literalEnglish: If weather hot then I drink much water

examples.vietnamese: Nếu em buồn thì em thường khóc
examples.english: If I'm sad, I usually cry
examples.literalEnglish: If I sad then I usually cry

examples.vietnamese: Nếu bạn ăn nhiều đường thì bạn bị béo
examples.english: If you eat a lot of sugar, you get fat
examples.literalEnglish: If you eat much sugar then you suffer fat

alternativeWords.title: Alternative Conditional Words
alternativeWords.description: Vietnamese has several alternatives to 'nếu' that add nuance or formality

words.usage: More emphatic than 'nếu', adds weight to the condition
words.example: Nếu như bạn cố gắng thì sẽ thành công
words.exampleEnglish: If you really try, you will succeed

words.usage: Introduces hypothetical scenarios, often for imagining possibilities
words.example: Giả sử bạn thắng xổ số, bạn sẽ làm gì?
words.exampleEnglish: Suppose you win the lottery, what will you do?

words.english: In case / In the event that
words.example: Trong trường hợp khẩn cấp, hãy gọi 115

words.usage: Negative condition—something will happen unless something else prevents it
words.example: Tôi sẽ đi, trừ khi trời mưa
words.exampleEnglish: I will go, unless it rains

words.usage: Sets a condition that must be met
words.example: Bạn có thể đi, miễn là về trước 10 giờ
words.exampleEnglish: You can go, as long as you're back before 10

words.english: You only need to / If only
words.usage: Emphasizes that the condition is simple or minimal
words.example: Chỉ cần bạn cố gắng thì mọi chuyện sẽ ổn
words.exampleEnglish: If you just try hard, everything will be fine

variations.title: Common Variations
variations.description: Ways Vietnamese speakers modify or shorten conditional structures

examples.description: In casual speech, 'nếu' can be dropped if context is clear
examples.vietnamese: Trời mưa thì tôi không đi
examples.english: If it rains, I won't go

examples.description: More common than omitting 'nếu', especially in speech
examples.vietnamese: Nếu bạn muốn, bạn có thể đi
examples.english: If you want, you can go

examples.description: When context is very clear, both can be omitted
examples.english: If it rains, I won't go
examples.notes: Only works when conditional relationship is obvious from context

examples.description: Sometimes Vietnamese puts the result first for emphasis
examples.vietnamese: Tôi sẽ không đi nếu trời mưa
examples.english: I will not go if it rains
examples.notes: Emphasizes the result. 'thì' is not used in this word order
